ratings.comment: He's difficult to understand, covers material too quickly, and does not put much of effort into making material accessible for the level of students that he's teaching.  He does care a lot about the subject, which is obvious.  It is not worth it to buy the textbook.  He will try to help you, but he won't explain anything well.

The class was okay and Dr. Carlson was a decent teacher.  The only reason I showed up to class everyday was just to oogle at Dr. Carlson hot body.  I would have done bad things to him if he would have asked.  Too bad I heard he was married. :(

Good lecturer, exams come from powerpoint and lecture, so just study those. Some test questions are poorly worded. Final is cumulative but the questions for the old material were exact replicas of the first midterm. Discussions don't relate to test material, but still go. HW is easy. Pretty interesting class I thought, not all geology is boring!
He's an okay prof.  His lecturing ability isn't the greatest, but he does okay.  Glaciology is clearly all he can teach, anything else is shaky.  Compared to other profs, he just isn't as good.
Anders is a great guy and a great professor.  He Is extremely approachable and knowledgeable.

He is the worst professor I have had at the UW. He doesn't know how to lecture, write tests, or communicate. I ended up with an A in the class but only because a 76 on one exam I got was equal to an A because everyone got 60% or lower. Go to class, print off slides, and study diagrams from slides. Thats all his tests are on.Book reading unnecessary

Professor Carlson is not a bad lecturer, but his exams (multiple choice)are poorly worded. Exam questions are taken straight from lecture material.  Lecture attendance is mandatory and enforced with clickers.  Don't bother with the textbook, because you won't ever use it.  Discussions are relatively easy, but some do not relate to lecture material.
